		<div class="comment-body"><h2>Lovin&#8217; LameBrain!  It&#8217;s very cool.  My question is this:  When ripping a CD, is the track encoded using LAME?  I&#8217;m rather new to this stuff.  I&#8217;m familiar with iTunes and I&#8217;ve used it with a script that encoded the track using LAME and wondered if LameBrain does the same.  Or&#8230; do I rip the cd and then encode using LAME.  Thanks for your help.</h2>
</div>
	</li>
	
	<li class="comment">
		<a name="1541" class="comment-id anchor"></a>
		<div class="comment-author">Ed Finkler</div>
		<div class="comment-author-url">http://www.funkatron.com</div>
		<div class="comment-date">02/18/2003 10:40:24 PM</date>
		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thanks David!</p>

<p>When you rip a CD with LameBrain, it does indeed use LAME to encode the file.  OS X makes it really easy to do this by presenting each track on the CD as an .aiff file.  The CD Ripper tool in LameBrain is really just a modified version of the batch encoder, the major difference being the FreeDB functionality.</p>

---
layout: post
author: funkatron
title: "Curse thee, Powerbook!"
url_title: curse_thee_powerbook
permalink: curse_thee_powerbook.html
tags: ""
published: true
category:
- General
date: 2003-01-26
summary: 
old_entry_id: 1778
---
<p>So something went wonky with my Powerbook, either in the power supply or the power plug in the machine itself, because it wouldn&#8217;t take any power when plugged-in.  So now I&#8217;ve got two empty batteries and a dead machine.  Hopefully it&#8217;s just a dead PS, which I can easily replace at work tomorrow.  If not, the machine will probably need to be sent back to Apple.</p>

<p>You don&#8217;t realize just how valuable a portable computer is until you suddenly have it taken from you.  The flexibility of being able to go anywhere in our home and be online is super, super nice, especially with a 3 month old.  I also am peeved because without my Powerbook, I can&#8217;t do anything with OS X, which means LameBrain dev is stalled for the time being.</p>

<p>This will probably be a good exercise for me.</p>

---
layout: post
author: funkatron
title: "Football"
url_title: football
permalink: football.html
tags: ""
published: true
category:
- General
date: 2003-01-19
summary: 
old_entry_id: 1770
---
<p>As you may know, I really really like Pro Football.  So today was exciting, because we had the games which determined who would play in next week&#8217;s SuperBowl.</p>

<p>I&#8217;ve gotten to the point where I can appreciate a good game and a good team without liking or disliking either of the teams involved.  Nevertheless, I do tend to favor one team over the other to some extent, especially when the stakes are as high as they were this week.  Unfortunately, both my preferred teams (the <a href="http://sports.espn.go.com/nfl/clubhouse?team=ten">Tennessee Titans</a> and the <a href="http://sports.espn.go.com/nfl/clubhouse?team=phi">Philadelphia Eagles</a>) lost.</p>

<p>Still, I can&#8217;t say I&#8217;m upset that the teams that won (<a href="http://sports.espn.go.com/nfl/clubhouse?team=oak">the Raiders</a> and <a href="http://sports.espn.go.com/nfl/clubhouse?team=tam">the Buccaneers</a>) will be in the SuperBowl.  Gruden <a href="http://msn.espn.go.com/nfl/playoffs02/columnist/2003/0119/1495409.html">leaving the Raiders and then meeting them the next year in the SuperBowl</a> is just too interesting.  This will be a good game, although if I were a betting man, I&#8217;d put my money on silver and black &#8212; they just seem like a more complete team.</p>

---
layout: post
author: funkatron
title: "My host eats it"
url_title: my_host_eats_it
permalink: my_host_eats_it.html
tags: ""
published: true
category:
- General
date: 2003-01-19
summary: 
old_entry_id: 1769
---
<p>Funkatron.com is hosted on <a href="http://www.qksrv.net/click-958332-1485227">HostRocket</a>.  In general they&#8217;re pretty decent, but they&#8217;re got some problems with their cgi stuff.  As I&#8217;ve stated before, you really want to run Movable Type with a cgi wrapper, because if you don&#8217;t, you have to leave some directories world-writable.  HostRocket has a cgi wrapper, but there are some problems with it that cause MT to throw 500 Internal Server Errors from time to time (like when anyone tries to post a comment).  Can anyone recommend a better inexpensive host that supports MT better?</p>




	 

<div id="comments" data-entry-id="1769" data-url-title="my_host_eats_it">
	<ul>
	
	<li class="comment">
		<a name="1537" class="comment-id anchor"></a>
		<div class="comment-author">bcj.</div>
		<div class="comment-author-url">http://briancjanes.com</div>
		<div class="comment-date">01/20/2003 12:08:47 PM</date>
		<div class="comment-body"><p>I recommend &lt;a href=&#8221;http://dreamhost.com&#8221;&gt;http://dreamhost.com&lt;/a&gt; . If you sign up with them, please tell them &#8220;bcj&#8221; sent you.</p>

<p>As for &#8220;inexpensive&#8221;, it&#8217;s all relative, and it depends on your needs. I&#8217;ve been with them for about 3 years and have been pleased. After reading up a bit more on their cgi wrapper stuff, here&#8217;s what they have to say about it:</p>

<p>Normally on a web server, CGI scripts run as the special unix user nobody in the group nogroup. That means that in order for the cgi to write or read files, they must be readable or writable to the world. This isn&#8217;t really that safe, since that means any other user on your server can read and write those files too!
On DreamHost servers, we have a special feature called suexec (which stands for &#8220;switch user execution&#8221;) turned on that makes your CGI scripts on your web site run as though they were run by your user and group!</p>

<hr />
</div>
	</li>
	 
	</ul>
</div>
<!-- end of post -->

---
layout: post
author: funkatron
title: "Fun with L. Ron Hubbard"
url_title: fun_with_l_ron_hubbard
permalink: fun_with_l_ron_hubbard.html
tags: ""
published: true
category:
- General
date: 2003-01-15
summary: 
old_entry_id: 1765
---
<p>From the video <a href="http://us.imdb.com/Quotes?0273687"><em>Introduction to Scientology</em></a></p>

<ul>
<li><strong>L. Ron Hubbard:</strong> You have to neglect illness, and the body, and so forth, to improve man.</li>
<li><strong>L. Ron Hubbard:</strong> Psychiatry has to do with the insane, and we have nothing to do with the insane 
whatsoever. The insane &#8212; well, uh, they&#8217;re insane.</li>
<li><strong>L. Ron Hubbard</strong>: I asked them one day, up at Oxford, &#8220;What &#8212; what &#8212; what does &#8216;Scientology&#8217; mean?&#8221; and 
they said &#8212; they &#8212; it means, really, &#8220;the study of knowledge&#8221; or &#8220;I know the word.&#8221;</li>
<li><strong>Tony Hitchman:</strong> But surely you&#8217;ve only got as much brain as you&#8217;re born with.<br />
<strong>L. Ron Hubbard:</strong> Oh, no &#8212; brain has nothing to do with it. Brain is a sort of a &#8212; well, I don&#8217;t know, brain 
is brain. What it does, I&#8217;m never quite sure.</li>
<li><strong>L. Ron Hubbard:</strong> The insane, and so forth, somebody else can have them, they&#8217;ve already failed.</li>
<li><strong>L. Ron Hubbard:</strong> But that&#8217;s psychotherapy. That&#8217;s for the neurotic, or the person who is insane, or 
something like that. That has nothing to do with Scientology. Scientology is for an able guy like you, or like me, uh, able to 
function in life, able to make his own way, does his work, and so forth - all right, THAT&#8217;S the man that should be helped; 
that&#8217;s the man you should help out, because that fellow is having a hard time, and uh, he&#8217;s got his problems.</li>
</ul>

---
layout: post
author: funkatron
title: "Objective C blows"
url_title: objective_c_blows
permalink: objective_c_blows.html
tags: ""
published: true
category:
- General
date: 2003-01-14
summary: 
old_entry_id: 1761
---
<p>I like my Mac a lot.  I use PCs all the time too, but I really enjoy my Mac more. I think it&#8217;s the combination of an elegant 
(although still flawed) GUI and UNIX guts.  I think it also helps that it&#8217;s a laptop, so I can carry it around the house with 
me.  My XP box in the back room doesn&#8217;t get used nearly as much, even though it has a fancy 19&#8221; LCD (a Samsung 191T &#8212; it 
totally rules).</p>

<p />

<p>Anyway, I decided to look into some GUI app dev on OS X. I had an idea, and tried implementing it in several different 
languages:</p>

<ul>
 <li><b>Applescript Studio</b>: This actually worked pretty well.  The language is SUPER verbose, but eventually I got 
my head around it.  It&#8217;s really easy to build GUI apps with it.  Problem is, the app was pretty unstable &#8212; it would just 
crash without any clear reason.  This may have been improved in newer versions, but it was unusable at the time</li>
 <li><b>Pure Java</b>: I actually got a command-line version of my app going.  That was great.  But I got lost quickly 
with the Swing stuff.  It didn&#8217;t help that all these layout frameworks and shit for Java just seem stupid.  Who would lay out 
a GUI with something that makes your buttons fill all the available space?</li>
 <li><b>Java->ObjC</b>: Total disaster here.  I never got this shit working.</li>
 <li><b>ObjC</b>: What the hell is this crap?  I thought it was C, but the damn syntax looks like some kind of Little 
Orphan Annie Ovaltine code.  A line of code should never start with a -.</li>
 <li><b>RealBasic</b>: You know, there are things I don&#8217;t like about RealBasic, but of all languages, this was by far 
the nicest to work with.  The IDE is really smooth and nicely integrated (the autocomplete on user-defined properties and 
methods is great).  Programming is fun again!</li>
</ul>

<p>Oh yeah, I got the comments working.  Looks like a silly bug with Hostrocket&#8217;s suexec wrapper.</p>

</div>
	</li>
	
	<li class="comment">
		<a name="1522" class="comment-id anchor"></a>
		<div class="comment-author">JiMMy</div>
		<div class="comment-author-url"></div>
		<div class="comment-date">04/12/2004 01:08:53 PM</date>
		<div class="comment-body"><p>Objective-C syntax is stupid! Both C# &#38; Java, language have reasonably similar OOP constructs (interface, etc), but both chose C++ style syntax (overloading, a.method())! Why?  If they had chosen Objective-C&#8217;s cumbersome syntax [[[obj alloc]init]do something], 99% of the developer woundn&#8217;t give it a second glance ;?)</p>

<p>Features in C++ are there for a reason. How long before you run into a name collision in large projects without namespace especially when you are importing libraries from other sources? How many ways can you write the same sorting routine without using inefficient calls (void* &#38; polymorphic object*) without overloading?
C++ atleast addresses these problems&#8230; Objective-C does not. Its cumbersome syntax does nothing to facilitate the programmer&#8217;s readability except to facilitate the compiler&#8217;s parser. In short, chose a language that lets machine do all the work &#38; not chose a language that helps machine to the work. Wish MacOSX chose these language in following order: C++ -&gt; C# -&gt; Java -&gt; Obj-C. Hell even javascript syntax is more palatable than Obj-C.</p>
</div>
	</li>
	 
	</ul>
</div>

---
layout: post
author: funkatron
title: "Movable Type"
url_title: movable_type
permalink: movable_type.html
tags: ""
published: true
category:
- General
date: 2003-01-14
summary: 
old_entry_id: 1758
---
<p>So in a lot of ways, Movable Type is pretty damn cool.  In other ways, it&#8217;s not so cool.  If your hosting doesn&#8217;t support 
suexec or some other kind of cgi wrapper, you have to chmod some directories to be world-writable, which is just ASKING for 
trouble if you&#8217;re on a shared host.  But holy hell is the admin system polished.  It makes me never even want to consider 
creating a system like this.</p>

<p>The comments don&#8217;t seem to be working.  I have no idea why not.  I&#8217;ll poke at it some when I get a chance, because I know 
you&#8217;re all chomping at the bit.</p>

---
layout: post
author: funkatron
title: "Let&#8217;s talk about the weather"
url_title: lets_talk_about_the_weather
permalink: lets_talk_about_the_weather.html
tags: ""
published: true
category:
- General
date: 2003-01-12
summary: 
old_entry_id: 1757
---
<p>Right now my Powerbook tells me it is 10 degrees fahrenheit [happy now chelle? 8)] outside.  It&#8217;s also sunny, which means that 
if it
was not sunny, it would be -700.  I wouldn&#8217;t know either way, because I don&#8217;t go outside &#8212; it&#8217;s overrated.</p>

<p>
Some people will say, &#8220;Ed, why a blog?  What happened to your music
stuff?  Are you a sucker?&#8221;  The answer to the latter should be obvious,
but as for the first two: </p>

<ol>
 <li>I&#8217;m a follower, not a leader</li>
 <li>I haven&#8217;t
written music in a long time, and I&#8217;m not sure I will anytime soon.  I
spend my time programming now, and taking care of my son</li>
</ol>

<p>Back to the weather.  I live in Lafayette, IN, which some people
seem to think is the South.  Anyone from the actual South will laugh in
your face when they see your &#8220;Hoosier by birth, Southern by the grace
of God&#8221; license plate, but some people still insist.  For their sake,
here&#8217;s a helpful cheat sheet to determine if you&#8217;re in the south:</p>

<ul>

 <li>If you balls just froze to your boxers, you&#8217;re not in the south</li>
</ul>

<p>I keep seeing <a href="http://us.imdb.com/Name?Cheadle,+Don">Don Cheadle</a> doing these NFL Playoffs commercials.  Now I 
<b>LOVE</b>
Don Cheadle.  He rules.  He&#8217;s one of my favorite actors ever.  But Don
(in case you&#8217;re reading), you&#8217;re not Sam Jackson.  Sam will always be
Jules.  If you&#8217;re gonna do these things, you need to bring Rocket, the
crazy Crip from <a href="http://us.imdb.com/Title?0094894">Colors</a>, or Mouse, the crazy guy in a suit from <a 
href="http://us.imdb.com/Title?0112857">Devil in a Blue Dress</a>, or Snoopy, the crazy prison inmate from <a 
href="http://us.imdb.com/Title?0120780">Out of Sight</a>.  You do not want to bring Buck Swopes from <a 
href="http://us.imdb.com/Title?0118749">Boogie Nights</a>.  Yes, Buck got laid all the time, but he was also a nerd, and 
Raiders fans will beat him up.</p>





<!-- end of post -->
